headline.main: You keep choosing the pain you recognize. Let's change that.
headline.micro: Break the trauma bond. Rewire your patterns. Build self-trust—in your body, and in safe love.

hero.captionsAvailable: Captions available - Click CC button in video player

subtitle.part1: It's not your fault. Your nervous system is like a broken GPS – it's been programmed by past experiences to mistake

overactiveAlarm.title: Overactive Alarm System
overactiveAlarm.description: Your nervous system treats healthy, available love as "boring" while lighting up for unavailable partners who trigger familiar patterns of activation.

traumaBond.title: Trauma-Bond Magnet
traumaBond.description: You unconsciously seek partners who recreate familiar dynamics, mistaking the stress response for "spark" and genuine connection.

safetyForeign.title: Safety Feels Foreign
safetyForeign.description: When someone treats you well consistently, your system doesn't recognize it as love – it feels unfamiliar, even uncomfortable or "too easy."

problem.quote: You're not broken. You're not choosing wrong. Your nervous system is just following outdated programming that once kept you safe but now keeps you stuck.

opportunity.headline: What If You Could Rewire Your Attraction Patterns?
opportunity.subtitle: Neuroscience shows us that the brain is remarkably plastic. With the right approach, you can literally rewire your nervous system to feel safe with healthy love.

method.title: The Attachment Rewiring Method™
method.description: A scientifically-backed system that combines attachment theory, cognitive behavioral techniques, and mindfulness practices to help you recognize, interrupt, and rewire the patterns that keep you stuck.

identify.title: Identify Patterns
identify.description: Recognize your unique trauma-bonding triggers and attachment wounds

rewire.title: Rewire Responses
rewire.description: Create new neural pathways that recognize healthy love as safe

attract.title: Attract Differently
attract.description: Naturally gravitate toward emotionally available, secure partners

overthinker.title: Overthinker
overthinker.description: You analyze every text, every interaction, constantly seeking reassurance and validation while your mind spirals with worst-case scenarios

traumaBondSurvivor.title: Trauma Bond Survivor
traumaBondSurvivor.description: You've done years of therapy but still find yourself magnetically drawn to partners who recreate familiar patterns of pain

fixer.title: The Fixer
fixer.description: You're attracted to 'potential' and believe you can heal or change your partners through enough love and understanding

whoThisIsFor.quote: If you're reading this and thinking 'this is me,' you're already more self-aware than most. That awareness is your superpower – now let's channel it into lasting change.

subtitle.part1: Stop settling for crumbs of affection. You deserve a

scientificProof.headline: Grounded in Real Science, Not Empty Promises
scientificProof.subtitle: The Unbound method combines decades of psychological research with practical, actionable strategies that create lasting change.

attachmentTheory.title: Attachment Theory
attachmentTheory.description: Understanding how early relationships shape your adult attachment patterns and romantic choices
attachmentTheory.citation: Bowlby, J. (1988). A Secure Base: Parent-Child Attachment and Healthy Human Development

cbt.title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
cbt.description: Evidence-based techniques to identify and change thought patterns that drive unhealthy relationship choices
cbt.citation: Beck, A. T. (1976). Cognitive Therapy and the Emotional Disorders

emotionalIntelligence.title: Emotional Intelligence
emotionalIntelligence.description: Developing the ability to recognize, understand, and manage your emotions in relationships
emotionalIntelligence.citation: Goleman, D. (1995). Emotional Intelligence: Why It Matters More Than IQ

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness Practices
mindfulness.description: Present-moment awareness techniques that help you respond rather than react in relationships
mindfulness.citation: Kabat-Zinn, J. (1994). Wherever You Go, There You Are: Mindfulness Meditation

scientificProof.quote: This isn't about positive thinking or manifestation. This is about understanding the neuroscience of attraction and using proven psychological principles to create real, lasting change.
scientificProof.disclaimer: Based on established psychological research and proven therapeutic methods.

story.part1: At 26, I reconnected with my high school love – and realized how wrong my wiring had been.
story.part2: For years, I had been unconsciously attracted to partners who triggered my trauma responses. I mistook anxiety for excitement, chaos for chemistry. When healthy love showed up, I didn't even recognize it.
story.quote: That moment of reconnection proved this method works. I had rewired my nervous system to finally feel safe with real love. Now I want to show you how to do the same.
story.part3: The Unbound method isn't theory – it's the exact process I used to break free from decades of painful patterns and create the secure, loving relationship I have today. If it worked for me, it can work for you too.

phase6.description: Apply everything you've learned to create lasting change in your daily life and relationships

faq.headline: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: I want you to feel completely confident in your decision. Here are answers to the most common questions.

trauma.question: Will this reopen trauma or make me feel worse?
trauma.answer: The Unbound method is designed to be trauma-informed and gentle. We focus on building awareness and new patterns rather than diving deep into past trauma. You'll work at your own pace and can pause whenever you need to. If you have severe trauma, I recommend working with a therapist alongside this program.

relationship.question: Does this work if I'm already in a relationship?
relationship.answer: Unbound is designed to help you improve your current relationship by breaking patterns of anxiety, overthinking, and insecurity. The tools help you show up more securely and communicate more effectively.

therapy.question: Is this just talk therapy or positive thinking?
therapy.answer: Not at all. This is a practical, action-based system that combines neuroscience, attachment theory, and cognitive behavioral techniques. You'll get specific tools, exercises, and strategies that create real change in how your nervous system responds to relationships.

results.question: How soon will I see results?
results.answer: Most women notice shifts in awareness within the first week and begin changing their responses within 2-3 weeks. Deeper pattern changes typically happen over 2-3 months of consistent practice. Remember, you're rewiring decades of conditioning – be patient and compassionate with yourself.

single.question: Do I have to be dating to benefit from this?
single.answer: No! This program is just as valuable if you're single and taking a break from dating. You can work on your patterns, build secure attachment with yourself, and prepare for healthier relationships when you're ready. Many women find this the perfect time to do the deep work.

tried.question: What if I've tried everything and nothing has worked?
tried.answer: I understand that frustration – I felt the same way. The difference with Unbound is that we address the nervous system patterns that drive your attraction, not just surface behaviors. If you've done therapy but still find yourself attracted to the same types of people, this program fills that gap.

faq.stillQuestions: Still have questions? I'm here to help.
faq.contact: Email me at support@herlifeunbound.com and I'll personally respond within 24 hours.
